perturbation.original_text: 5.5. The Promotion Fees shall be paid to DD by MBRK fifteen (15) days after the receipt of an invoice from DD by MBRK.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.5. The Promotion Fees shall be paid to DD by MBRK forty-five (45) days after the receipt of an invoice from DD by MBRK.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction. Section 5.5 originally stated that Promotion Fees should be paid within fifteen (15) days of invoice receipt. The modification changes this to forty-five (45) days, creating uncertainty about the actual payment deadline. This could lead to disputes over late payment penalties or interest.

perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree to meet via conference call within five (5) business days of the end of each month to determine the necessary adjustment, if any, to the Deposit. If it is determined that the Deposit must be increased, within ten (10) business days of the date upon which the new Deposit is determined, MBRK shall send to DD the funds necessary to increase the Deposit.
perturbation.changed_text: The Parties agree to meet via conference call within fifteen (15) business days of the end of each month to determine the necessary adjustment, if any, to the Deposit. If it is determined that the Deposit must be increased, within five (5) business days of the date upon which the new Deposit is determined, MBRK shall send to DD the funds necessary to increase the Deposit.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by providing conflicting timelines. First the meeting to determine any adjustment to the deposit has to happen within 5 days but later its written that it has to happen within 15 days. Then, the deposit must be increased within 10 days but later is written that it must be increased within 5 days. This creates uncertainty about the actual deadlines.

perturbation.original_text: Section 18 — Termination and Fees This Agreement may be terminated as follows: (a) Either party hereto shall have the right to terminate this Agreement after thirty (30) days written notice to the other in the event the other is in breach of this Agreement unless the breaching party cures the breach before the expiration of such period of time. Each such notice shall set forth in reasonable detail the specifics of the breach.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 18 — Termination and Fees This Agreement may be terminated as follows: (a) Either party hereto shall have the right to terminate this Agreement after sixty (60) days written notice to the other in the event the other is in breach of this Agreement unless the breaching party cures the breach before the expiration of such period of time. Each such notice shall set forth in reasonable detail the specifics of the breach.
perturbation.explanation: The modification changes the number of days' written notice required to terminate the agreement from thirty (30) days to sixty (60) days, creating ambiguity. This contradiction creates uncertainty about the actual deadline and may lead to disputes over contract termination validity.
